programme.title: Shadow Ops

programme.title: Shadow Ops

programme.title: Brothels That Built America

programme.desc: Courtenay Savage is an ex-cop with a loaded gun aimed at a friend's trailer. She has no idea she is caught on tape. After an arrest and posting bail, she goes on the run, leaving ties to the police department and the sex industry.(n)

programme.title: I (Almost) Got Away With It
programme.desc: Patsy Jones was the leader of a band of thieves, targeting tourists leaving the Miami airport by robbing and carjacking them at gunpoint. When she murders one of her targets, Jones hides out in an abandoned apartment.(n)

programme.title: I (Almost) Got Away With It
programme.desc: A fugitive murders a man and flees to New York, where he plans a daring escape, while another breaks out of jail by overpowering a guard.(n)

programme.title: I (Almost) Got Away With It
programme.sub-title: GOT to Crawl My Way to Freedom
programme.desc: After a botched robbery, Darryl Norris faces murder charges and a long prison sentence. He pulls off a brilliant escape through the ceiling of his cell and plans to flee the country. But authorities are determined to find him and lock him up for good.(n)

programme.title: Hitler's Empire: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: In this episode we'll examine how the Nazis began to stamp their image on Germany and the nations that had fallen under the German jackboot. From plans to redesign Berlin as the capital of the world, to the destruction of Warsaw.(n)

programme.title: Hitler's Empire: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: In this episode, we'll see how Hitler used the Olympic games to promote Nazism. How he controlled the leisure time and holidays of his Citizens by developing the world's largest travel agency. And how by constructing the world's biggest beach resort.(n)

programme.title: Hitler's Empire: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: In this episode, Guy looks at the Nazi plans for Britain. From pre-war spying, concentration camps on British soil, to national landmarks earmarked by Hitler for his own use.(n)

programme.title: Hitler's Empire: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: At look at how Hitler's redesign of the German transport system was a key factor in his preparations for war, including how he used the car industry for the rearmament of his military and see his plans for a colossal rail system.(n)

programme.title: Hitler's Empire: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: In this episode we'll uncover support for the National Socialist movement within America, revealing outposts of Nazi Germany within the land of the free. We'll also learn about the man thought he believed he was the American Fuhrer.(n)

programme.title: Hitler's Empire: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: A look at how Hitler implemented changes through anti-Semitic clothing laws, the establishing of SS bride schools and breeding programmes that saw children stolen from their parents.(n)

programme.title: Bullet Points
programme.desc: From 1948 to 1973 the Arabs and Israelis went to war five times for territory in the holy land of Palestine. See the key operations in one of the longest ongoing conflicts in world history.(n)

programme.title: Warrior POV
programme.desc: Fallujah, Iraq's most volatile city, has become a haven for radical Muslim fighters from around the world. To root them out, the U.S. military unleashes Operation Phantom Fury. Soldiers and Marines engage the enemy in brutal urban combat.(n)

programme.title: Ultimate Warfare
programme.desc: In what would become one of the most brutal and decisive battles of the Iraq war, a battalion of tanks punches a hole right into the heart of Saddam Hussein's Baghdad in 2003. They are the first Mechanised force to enter a capitol city since WWII.(n)

programme.title: Warrior POV
programme.desc: See the shot by shot firefights in the 21 day bloody battle for Baghdad from the warrior's point of view.(n)

programme.title: Bullet Points
programme.desc: In 1991, the United States and an unprecedented coalition of over 30 countries join forces to liberate Kuwait from invading Iraq dictator, Saddam Hussein. Highlights from the key battles, weapons and strategies that lead to a decisive victory.(n)

programme.title: Ultimate Warfare
programme.sub-title: Fallujah: The Taking of Terror Central
programme.desc: Operation Phantom Fury was meant to be a 48 hour battle but insurgents, armed with IEDs and a stockpile of grenades, fought back. US forces faced one of the toughest urban conflicts since Vietnam as they tried to reclaim the city.(n)

programme.title: Warrior POV
programme.desc: In 2010, the 'Screaming Eagles' of the 101st Airborne Division face off against the Taliban during Operation Dragon Strike. The American soldiers of the 101st head up Afghanistan's 'Highway to Hell' to take back the countryside from a deadly enemy.(n)

programme.title: CIA Declassified
programme.desc: With testimony from those directly involved, the de-classified truth of the 15-year manhunt for Osama bin Laden is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Bin Laden: A Terrorist Mastermind
programme.desc: See how Osama Bin Laden's journey unfolds; from his roots as a privileged young Saudi boy to becoming the formidable leader of al-Qaeda, and his lifetime commitment to violent terror against the West, resulting in the horrific 9/11 attacks in 2001.(n)

programme.title: Ultimate Warfare
programme.desc: 36 U.S Special Forces face a Taliban insurgence 5 times their size. Facing I.E.Ds , RPG's and vicious counter attacks, they fight for their lives to take the hill of Sperwan Ghar, as control of the hill is control of Kandahar.(n)

programme.title: Warrior POV
programme.desc: In Afghanistan in 2006, US Army Green Berets take on nearly 1000 Taliban fighters in one of the most intense battles of the War on Terror. Five years after the 9/ 11 attacks, Task Force 31 launches a full-scale attack on a hill called Sperwan Ghar.(n)

programme.title: Lone Star Law: Uncuffed
programme.desc: As gator season kicks off, game wardens pursue a nuisance gator harassing boaters and go undercover to catch a suspect selling illegal gator parts. Meanwhile, a boater is reported missing and the dive team deploys to search.

programme.title: Northwest Law: Uncuffed
programme.desc: Two elderly men are saved from their capsized boat on Puget Sound, and a team handles a hostile gold miner. A stakeout leads a sergeant to confront a black-market shrimp trafficker, and a safety check is done on orca whales found near San Juan Islands.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: An owner drives nine hours to the clinic hoping Dr. Jeff can save her dog's leg. Jeff and his team head to a wildlife sanctuary to treat a pack of wolves. When a kitten with a deformed leg needs treatment, Dr. Baier steps up to the plate.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Two sisters rush their tiny dog to the clinic with a life-threatening brain injury. Dr. Jeff is perplexed by a dog with a broken jaw. A fearless cat with a broken leg wins the admiration of the clinic staff, and the team treats some uncooperative yaks.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A trio of new penguin chicks are introduced to the pool for their first swim. Family dynamics change when the mandrill monkey troop welcomes a new baby. Plus, a pair of king vultures are prepped for their big debut at the Queens Zoo.

programme.desc: Tia races to rescue four dogs from a rural shelter in Louisiana from euthanasia. Mariah and Toney give a scared, shy dog a shot at a forever home, while a unique canine gets a chance at a Pennsylvania prison dog program.

programme.desc: Texas Game Wardens go undercover to stop a black market for buying and selling wild animals. A trio of Wardens work the beaches of Galveston and mobilize when an oil spill threatens wildlife. A robotic deer decoy is used to catch night hunters.

programme.desc: An analysis and perspective on current political and socioeconomic issues with a focus on the implications for newer generations who are shaping a rapidly changing American landscape.(n)

programme.title: Ozzy and Jack's World Detour
programme.desc: On the agenda: medical oddities, a penitentiary, chocolate making and a voyage 220 feet underground, where Jack will reveal his biggest surprise, a relic from Ozzy's past.(n)

programme.title: Ozzy and Jack's World Detour
programme.desc: Jack and Ozzy learn about competitive lumberjacks. When Jack gets the flu, Ozzy visits a coffee roaster himself. After Jack recovers, they visit an oyster farm and then visit a medium.(n)

programme.title: Ozzy and Jack's World Detour
programme.desc: Jack and Kelly plan alternate days' activities. Kelly takes the guys to eat some fresh ice cream, but Jack fires back with a trip to a Mining, aka, an 'Explosion School.'.(n)

programme.title: Ozzy and Jack's World Detour
programme.desc: Ozzy and Jack's bucket lists collide when father and son head to the UK. While both want to visit Stonehenge, the mythic structure of Druid lore, the rest of their itinerary is up for debate, and both Ozzy and Jack each want their way.(n)

programme.title: Ozzy and Jack's World Detour
programme.desc: In 1982, something happened at the Alamo that instantly became both rock 'n' roll lore and a bold question mark in the Osbourne family. Along the way the guys take a couple of detours, including NASA's Johnson Space Center.(n)

programme.title: Ozzy and Jack's World Detour
programme.desc: At their Key West starting point, Ozzy and Jack do some deep-sea fishing, hunt pythons in the Everglades and drive by Mar-a-Lago, President Trump's Winter White House.(n)

programme.title: Ozzy and Jack's World Detour
programme.desc: After completing their cross-country adventure, Ozzy and Jack thank wives Sharon and Lisa for holding down the fort in their absence with a trip to Kona, Hawaii, also known as the 'Big Island.'.(n)

programme.title: Wahlburgers
programme.desc: Donnie takes Bob and Oscar to scout a potential Wahlburgers location in St. Charles, Illinois, and pulls out all the stops to convince Oscar to make Chicago his college town.(n)

programme.title: Wahlburgers
programme.desc: With the success of the Wahlburgers locations near sports venues, Mark and Paul visit the Tottenham Hotspur of the English Premier League to discuss a potential London franchise.(n)

programme.title: Wahlburgers
programme.desc: Mark meets Paul in Scotland, and informs Paul that he's offered up his chef services to Lady Hopetoun and her guests at her family's palatial estate. Alma learns that she must take a driver's test again in order to renew her licence.(n)

programme.title: Wahlburgers
programme.desc: Mark works with the franchisee of the new Detroit Wahlburgers to make sure the location opens up in record time. Mark pulls Paul out of Chicago to finish manager training after pushing the Detroit grand opening date.(n)

programme.title: Wahlburgers
programme.desc: Mark lets Alma take his daughters Ella and Grace out for a girl’s day of shopping and makeovers.(n)

programme.title: Wahlburgers
programme.desc: With Wahlburgers on the verge of closing a deal to open hundreds of locations in Asia, Mark gives Paul the final say in testing the partnership. Donnie prepares a video speech. Alma learns she's going to me a grandmother again from an unlikely source.(n)

programme.title: Wahlburgers
programme.desc: Mark invites Alma to be his red carpet date for the Boston premiere of 'Patriot's Day.' Meanwhile, Paul visits the Las Vegas Wahlburgers where new neighbour and country music legend John Rich proposes a delicious business partnership.Guests: John Rich..(n)

programme.title: Wahlburgers
programme.desc: Mark embarks on a packed business trip across the U. S. that includes an opportunity to create the first Wahlburgers action figure.(n)

programme.title: Wahlburgers

programme.title: Wahlburgers
programme.sub-title: Nice Day for a Wahl Wedding
programme.desc: Mark brings his friend Sexy Kenny, an outspoken hibachi chef, to Hingham and forces Paul to hire him at Wahlburgers, much to Paul's dismay. Across the street, Donnie teaches Alma how to bartend in his own special way.(n)

programme.title: Wahlburgers
programme.desc: As Paul visits potential San Francisco locations, he discovers a meatless patty that he wants to put on the menu. Paul delivers the burger to Mark for the ultimate taste test. Donnie asks Danny Wood to help him with promotions.(n)

programme.desc: A single mom vanishes without a trace. Foul play is confirmed when a truck toolbox opens to her body inside. Homicide detectives investigate men she matched on dating sites, men from work, and a lover with a violent past.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: He is a sex offender and a murderer who attacks in a terrifying rage. This predator manages to evade capture for years, but he leaves evidence behind – his palm print. Detectives are determined to put a face to the print.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: The murder of teacher’s aide leaves a hole in the heart of her small community. As rumors spread about suspects, the actual perp slipped further away. Investigators and a scientific breakthrough lead to a shocking end of the case.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: A young woman is found murdered on the side of a rural driveway. The victim had been out with friends. The investigation would remain unsolved. Until three decades later, when forensics from an unrelated crime helps breaks the case.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: A hearing impaired 77-year-old on a road trip is shot to death. Because the man cannot hear his assailant’s demands. Random murders are among the hardest crimes to solve, but investigators are determined to bring this case to justice.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: A wounded woman crawls to call 911. Her husband who wants a divorce gets a hard look from police. But he has an airtight alibi during the murder. Forensic science of ballistics draws a direct connection to an unexpected conclusion.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: A 20-year-old woman sets out on her bike and never returns. Her body found a few miles from her house with a gunshot wound to the head. Years go by without any evidence or leads, until new investigators and technology breaks the case.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: A navy lieutenant is murdered while deployed out to sea. Cause of death? Arsenic poisoning. Investigators discover he had more than his fair share of enemies. But it takes years before investigators discover what really happened to him.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: Three sex workers are murdered and left along a river. A serial killer was on the loose and for years the perp was never identified. 20 years later an arrest is finally made, but no one could have ever imagined who was behind the crime.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: A religious woman is shot execution style in the suburbs of Michigan. Surveillance video reveals it was trio of killers. Eventually, detectives get a break: a handwritten note.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: A building manager finds the lifeless body of a young woman in the bathtub. When questioned, an ex-con living downstairs lies to police. The lies do not prove murder and the case goes cold. Then a new forensic tool examines the evidence.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A house erupts into flames on a winter night, killing one person and injuring another. The survivor blamed a kerosene heater for the fire, but the evidence did not match her story.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1957 the police search for a man who committed several crimes in one night, including murder. Eventually, the case turned cold. Almost fifty years later, with the help of scientific advances, the investigators find their man.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A wealthy man goes missing, and leaves behind instructions in his will regarding what should be done if he died of violent circumstances, leading to believe he was aware his life was in danger.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murder of an American tourist in Mexico seems to be burglary related. However, closer examination by law officials both sides of the border reveal a far more sinister truth.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Exactly one year after beginning an affair with his friend's wife, a man vanishes. It's not until 15 years and a metal detector later that investigators will uncover the truth behind the disappearance.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: With no suspects or motives, investigators can't make sense of a murder when a young woman is found dead near the highway. A tiny piece of unique fibre on the victim's clothing will lead to the most unlikely killer.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A street fight takes the life of a wrestler. A jury believes the accused killed in cold blood. He gets sentenced to twenty years in prison. Six years later, he is granted another trial when a forensic animator offers a different explanation.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a 19-year-old girl is first found dead in her car, it seems to be an apparent suicide. Unsatisfied investigators probe the case further and discover the girl was involved in a complicated love quadrangle, giving several people a motive to kill her.(n)
